isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - MAIN COUNTERSHAFTS

note.para: The bearing cup and the bearing cone must be replaced as an assembly. Do not replace the cup or the cone separately. Replace the cup and the cone in a matched set from the same manufacturer.

step1.para: Lubricate all parts with new oil that is used in the transmission. Refer to GROUP 10-LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Use paint to put a timing mark on two teeth of each countershaft driven gear. Make sure the timing mark is aligned with the slot for the key and the "O" stamping on the countershaft ( Figure 309).

figure.caption: Figure 309. Timing Mark On Countershaft Driven Gear

step1.para: Use paint to put a timing mark on one tooth of the main drive gear on the input shaft. Put another paint mark directly opposite (180 degrees) the first mark (Figure 310).
Install the lower countershaft so that the large gears are toward the front of the case. Move the countershaft toward the side of the case (Figure 311).
Install the upper countershaft assembly in the case. The large gears must be toward the front of the case. Move the countershaft toward the side of the case ( Figure 312).
Install a long bolt or T-Handle Tool in the hole in the front of the upper countershaft. The tool or the bolt makes the countershaft easier to move.
Rotate the input shaft and move the lower countershaft assembly so that the timing marks are aligned (Figure 313).
